Fines are steep for things like speeding , using your phone while driving , or not yielding at a roundabout. So watch out for those pitfalls. The motorway vignette is required for using the Autobahn, but if you’re renting a car in Switzerland, it’s usually already included. For more specific rules, I’ve covered all the key points in this guide on Swiss traffic rules . Know the Swiss traffic rules before you hit the road. The vignette is your "ticket" for Swiss highways. The costs of a road trip A road trip through Switzerland isn’t cheap, but it doesn’t have to break your budget either. The biggest expenses are usually car rental, fuel and accommodation. Fuel prices fluctuate, but you can expect to pay around CHF 1.80 per liter. Parking in cities can add up quickly, so it's worth checking in advance whether your hotel offers free parking or if you'll need to pay extra. Accommodation prices vary depending on where and when you travel. Mountain villages are generally cheaper than cities and prices are lower in spring
